abstract: Wall Street’s collective heart was set aflutter earlier Monday after a report from a British newspaper said that Dow Chemical would be the target of a $50 billion leveraged buyout. If true, the deal would have been the biggest trophy yet for private equity firms, two of whom have not even completed the $45 billion takeover of TXU, the Texas energy giant.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street’s collective heart was set aflutter earlier Monday after a report from a British newspaper said that Dow Chemical would be the target of a $50 billion leveraged buyout. If true, the deal would have been the biggest trophy yet for private equity firms, two of whom have not even completed the $45 billion takeover of TXU, the Texas energy giant.

headline.main: Dow Chemical Insists It Isn’t for Sale
